original_title: Trees fall at US Masters Golf Tournament; no injuries
original_body_lines: Colombo (News 1st) – The U.S. Masters Golf Tournament in Augusta, Georgia, U.S.A, one of the four major tournaments in the world, was disrupted by trees falling on to the course in several places on Friday due to high winds while players and spectators were on the course. Miraculously, no one was hurt.
Some of the biggest names in golf, including the likes of Tiger Woods, are competing for this prestigious trophy. The tournament is held from the 6-9 April, 2023.
